title: Question 7

children: A 35-year-old woman is evaluated for vulvar and perianal pruritus and dyspareunia.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient has anogenital lichen sclerosus. Anogenital lichen sclerosus is a chronic dermatitis characterized by atrophic white plaques or papules extending over the perineum and around the anus in a figure 8 or “keyhole” configuration. Lesions may also be purpuric, hyperkeratotic, bullous, or ulcerated. Common symptoms include itching, dysuria, and dyspareunia. Diagnosis is confirmed by biopsy. Women with lichen sclerosus are at increased risk for squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva.
